title: Is the essay portion of the SAT needed for every University I apply to? - Quora

response.answer_text: It really depends on which schools you’re applying to and what the rest of your application looks like. There is a list of SAT essay policies of College and Scholarship Providers on the College Board website that is helpful. The top schools are pretty evenly split. Most liberal arts colleges do not require or recommend the SAT with the essay, but there are a few exceptions. And state schools are also pretty evenly divided. If the university recommends it (not requires it), it would still be in your best interest to do the essay. As always, check with the admissions team at the universities you are interested in to confirm their policy. They will be happy to walk you through their specific processes. Best of luck!

Not really. Only a few of them require. You need to visit online admission blogs of your target college to conclude, especially their standardized tests policy page. Standardized Testing for Stanford says Standardized testing is one of the application requirements that can highlight academic preparedness. There are no minimum test scores required to be admitted to Stanford, and there is no score that guarantees admission. At Stanford, we review applications holistically, meaning every component of the application is valuable to us as we get to know each student. Required testing:  ACT or SAT (Writing/Essay not required)College SAT Essay Policies helps you to arrive at a decision.

Do not worry about the essay part if you are confident about it. It depends on the universities that accept high scores on the exam. You should consider your target universities that are not into the exam. However, you can try working on the essay, not for the university but to enhance your writing skills.
Most, but not all. Check the web page of each University for their requirements.
Not all, but most really good or elite ones do require it. Check with the college you want to attend - their requirements will be on their website, etc.
